metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3213 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The gesture handling code in Clutter before 1.16.2 allows physically proximate attackers to bypass the lock screen via certain (1) mouse or (2) touch gestures.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clutter-1.0-tests - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
gir1.2-clutter-1.0 - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
libclutter-1.0-0 - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
libclutter-1.0-common - 1.16.4-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> The GNOME bug hints that this patch might be the fix

criterions.comment: clutter-1.0 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.4-0ubuntu2').
